commitResults.messageTitle: Actually finishes Level-5, the last one finishes automated test ui testing
Reorganises functions Adds tests Retargets testing target
Level 7, adds serialisation and deserialisation abilities
applies date and time parsing, sorting and filtering
Extracts functions into classes and packages them
Reorganises invocation flow of command classes
commitResults.messageBody: The last commit had commands with functions that do not serve concrete purposes. This commit ensures that execute() is used to perform looping instructions until termination and parse(String) is used to parse new commands that will be interpreted within this class, either from the execute method, or from an external user that calls parse on this object.

The previous iteration did not have any documentation
Therefore, this iteration adds documentations to nearly every method in every class.
The previous iteration had all package names in uppercase. This commit fixes all packages to lowercase.

The previous commit does not have any ability to query task names
This commit adds the ability to find any consecutive characters and return the entire task if it exists in its full name

The previous commit does not have any ability to query task names
This commit adds the ability to find any consecutive characters and return the entire task if it exists in its full name

The last merge overwrote some package names back to capital letters.
This commit reverses the overwrite by renaming offending packages back to lowercase.
The last merge broke several restructured commands. This commit adds them back.
The last merge broke several restructured commands. This commit adds them back.

Package naming was not synchronised properly across the Intellij package names and the actual package names. There were also several overwritten errors due to merge that caused progress loss.

This commit revises everything and compiles the program as it should have before.

The last iteration had no visual GUI
This is a massive change by adding a GUI, recognising the user by computer username and saving to task list automatically.
This commits makes the UI look nicer with more colors
Changes fonts and format of dialog boxes
Creates a more aesthetically pleasing UI design. Involves visual changes only with no functionality changes.

The last commit had no build version specified. This commit specifies a build version.
This commit also changes the directory name of the Save File

The last version did not have appropriate JavaDocs for ListTasksCommand class header. This commit adds the comments.
In additional, there were unused imports that were not removed - this commit will remove them.

To ensure the accuracy of this codebase and minimise error occurances, let us add asserts to specific points in the code. They signify the tautological assumptions at each point of execution, failing which implies that there is are unaccounted corner cases, which should not have led to that execution point.
Doing this will help us reduce the amount of time spent on future debugs by making our assumptions clear.

The last commit already had streams used. This commit applies the use of streams more frequently, particularly whenever a for or foreach loop is encountered. This helps in the code being read more naturally.
Updates the task list ui

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactors Code for Single Input Parsing
commitResults.messageBody:
Before this commit, the code was set up in a way that requires multi staged inputs, such as first entering into a task stage, then executing commands in the task stage. As per the suggestions in the guidelines, this is now changed to single line input and will now require execution in one line only.

For example: task add todo do laundry

Some exceptions are reserved for confirmation commands, but need not be answered and can be ignore.

For example: task delete all
> Are you sure you want to delete all tasks?
One can choose to say yes, no, or ignore this prompt altogether and issue another command, on which the previous instruction will be ignored and the new command will be executed instead.

Updates to the GUI added: Dark Mode

This commit will apply nicer looking transitions to the GUI such as horizontal and vertical sliding, window resizing and anchoring changes.
A new background is also added.
Widget version of the task list was removed due to incompatibility.

For better adherance to checkstyle, as well as a tidier package hierachy, the codebase was refactors to put Task related classes into a tasks package and UI related classes into userinterface package.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fixes GUI and Adds More Functionalities
commitResults.messageBody:
GUI smooth scrolling and sliding has been fixed. The window will now resize chat bubbles based on their text length and font.
The Loan recording function has been added.
Added the ability to change your name.

commitResults.messageTitle: Adds Readme and UI to Docs Folder

commitResults.messageBody: This reverts commit 34415a4315302a7a0ae31eaaa60601db66c5c571.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modifies Help Command to Redirect to User Guide
Adds Ability to Open Folder for Setting Pictures
Fix an Issue with Linux systems Not Loading Background
commitResults.messageBody: The last version had the background in a jpg format, which for some reason is not able to be loaded properly on Linux based system. This version converts the image to PNG format.
Fixes typos.
Encountering issue with Linux system not being able to be run with Djdk.gtk.version=2. Hopefully, this fixes it. I'll have to see when I deploy to Linux Ubuntu.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fixes Critical Typo Issue with SaveFile Name
commitResults.messageBody: Changed saveFile to savefile on line 31 of LoadUserCommand. Note the small letter f in the middle of the word
Adds more test cases pertaining to tasklist, loans and date time parsing
